articles.title: Ohio State football is barring Dave Portnoy from entering Ohio Stadium with Big Noon Kickoff: Report - Cleveland.com
articles.description: Ohio State football is taking action to keep Dave Portnoy out of Ohio Stadium when Big Noon Kickoff has him in town, according to a report.

articles.description: The two-time U.S. Open champion made her first appearance there since 2023.

articles.title: Desmond Watson, the heaviest player in NFL history, will be released by Tampa Bay, AP source says - AP News
articles.description: The heaviest player in NFL history may not get a chance to play in the league. Desmond Watson will be released by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, a person with knowledge of the decision told The Associated Press on Monday. The person spoke on condition of anonymity…

articles.title: YouTube TV could lose Fox channels this week - The Verge
articles.description: YouTube TV and Fox say that their broadcast agreement could expire on August 27th, dropping Fox News, Fox Sports, and local networks.

articles.title: Boone: Yankees Still Consider Volpe Starting Shortstop - MLB Trade Rumors
articles.description: The Yankees are sticking by Anthony Volpe, keeping him as their starting shortstop after a brief respite. Find out more at MLB Trade Rumors.

articles.title: Pirates Notes: Chandler, Infield, Rodriguez - MLB Trade Rumors
articles.description: Bubba Chandler could make some starts in 2025. Jared Triolo may play some SS in 2026. Is Endy Rodriguez a catcher? Read more at MLB Trade Rumors.

articles.title: Trevon Diggs on returning to practice, aiming for Week 1 return vs. Eagles - Dallas Cowboys
articles.description: On Monday, Cowboys cornerback Trevon Diggs talked about returning to the practice field for the first time since last season. He cleared the air about his relationship with the team's training staff, and is aiming to return for Week 1 against Philadelphia

articles.title: Tennessean named Babe Ruth charged with fraud - ESPN
articles.description: A Tennessee man with the same name as New York Yankees legend Babe Ruth is facing charges alleging that he used the names of hundreds of dead or retired pro baseball players to make phony claims for payouts in class action settlements.
